spirals.title: Catalog Services for the Web (CSW) Core Queryables
spirals.description: The Open Geospatial Consortium Catalog Services for the Web (CSW) standard defines 11 Core Queryables that must be supported in any compliant implementation. Profiles of CSW map these queryables to concepts and xPaths for particular metadata dialects. For additional reference information see the ISO Profile of CSW (Table 6).

items.name: Keyword
items.note: The general identification keywords usually have a type of theme and are refered to as theme keywords. Other types and vocabularies are used for other information. Service Entry Resource Format (SERF) requires a Science and a Service GCMD Keyword. This concept is called Subject in the CSW Specification.
items.description: A word or phrase that describes some aspect of a resource. Can be one of several types.

items.name: Resource Title
items.description: A short description of the resource. The title should be descriptive enough so that when a user is presented with a list of titles the general content of the data set can be determined.

items.name: Abstract
items.note: This concept is called Desciption in Catalog Services for the Web.
items.description: A paragraph describing the resource.

items.name: Resource Format
items.description: The physical or digital manifestation of the resource

items.name: Metadata Identifier
items.description: A phrase or string which uniquely identifies the metadata file/record.

items.name: Modified Date
items.description: Date on which the record was created or updated within the catalogue

items.name: Resource Type
items.description: A resource code identifying the type of resource e.g. dataset, a collection, an application (see MD_ScopeCode) which the metadata describes.

items.name: Bounding Box
items.note: This concept is called Coverage in the CSW Specification
items.description: A bounding box for identifying a geographic area of interest

items.name: Coordinate Reference System (CRS)
items.description: Geographic Coordinate Reference System (Authority and ID) for the BoundingBox

items.name: Association
items.description: Complete statement of a one-to-one relationship

spirals.title: Catalog Services for the Web (CSW) Core Returnable Properties
spirals.description: The Open Geospatial Consortium Catalog Services for the Web (CSW) standard defines 15 Core Returnables that must be supported in any compliant implementation. Profiles of CSW map these queryables to concepts and xPaths for particular metadata dialects. For additional reference information see the ISO Profile of CSW (Table 9).

items.name: Resource Title
items.description: A short description of the resource. The title should be descriptive enough so that when a user is presented with a list of titles the general content of the data set can be determined.

items.name: Author / Originator
items.note: In CSW this concept is called Creator
items.description: The principal author of the resource

items.name: Keyword
items.note: The general identification keywords usually have a type of theme and are refered to as theme keywords. Other types and vocabularies are used for other information. Service Entry Resource Format (SERF) requires a Science and a Service GCMD Keyword. This concept is called Subject in the CSW Specification.
items.description: A word or phrase that describes some aspect of a resource. Can be one of several types.

items.name: Abstract
items.note: This concept is called Desciption in Catalog Services for the Web.
items.description: A paragraph describing the resource.

items.name: Publisher
items.description: Publisher of the cited resource

items.name: Contributor Name
items.description: Contributor to the resource

items.name: Modified Date
items.description: Date on which the record was created or updated within the catalogue

items.name: Resource Type
items.description: A resource code identifying the type of resource e.g. dataset, a collection, an application (see MD_ScopeCode) which the metadata describes.

items.name: Resource Format
items.description: The physical or digital manifestation of the resource

items.name: Metadata Identifier
items.description: A phrase or string which uniquely identifies the metadata file/record.

items.name: Source Citation
items.description: Reference to the processing input source.

items.name: Metadata Language
items.description: Language of the metadata

items.name: Related Resource Citation
items.description: Citation information about the associated resource.

items.name: Bounding Box
items.note: This concept is called Coverage in the CSW Specification
items.description: A bounding box for identifying a geographic area of interest

items.name: Rights
items.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource

spirals.title: Catalog Service for the Web (CSW) Additional Queryable Properties
spirals.description: The Open Geospatial Consortium Catalog Services for the Web (CSW) standard supports 10 Additional Queryable search parameters. Profiles of CSW map these queryables to concepts and xPaths for particular metadata dialects. For additional reference information see the ISO Profile of CSW (Table 10).

items.name: Revision Date
items.description: Date of revision of the cited resource

items.name: Resource Creation/Revision Date
items.description: The date the resource was created

items.name: Publication Date
items.description: Date of publication of the cited resource

items.name: Organization Name
items.description: Name of the organization

items.name: Security Constraints
items.description: Handling restrictions imposed on the resource or metadata for national security or similar security concerns.

items.name: Metadata Language
items.description: Language of the metadata

items.name: Resource Identifier
items.description: Identifier for the resource described by the metadata

items.name: Parent Identifier
items.description: A unique identifier for a parent dataset or collection

items.name: Keyword Type
items.description: Methods used to group similar keywords
